bibl.title: C. H. Smith v. Defendant. Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Territory of Washington, County of King
In the district court holding terms at Seattle. In the matter of the application of C. I. H. Smith For a writ of Habeas Corpus.

C. I. H. Smith being dulybswron on oa h ststes thatbhe is the pet itioner named in the above entitled cause that he has been imprisoned ever since the 8th. day of Oct. 1888 being now over four months that he is naimed named he having lost by amputation his left hand and is unable to perform manuel labormexecpt something of a nature requiring only the use of one hand that he is a poor person. That he has no money or property of any kind; and that is a stranger in this part of the Country and has no relation or friends of whome he could borrow any money and therefor is unable to furnish the money to-wit the sum of five dollars required by the clerk of the said district court to be paid upon the filing od his petition fir a writ og Habeas Corpus.

Wherefor;: Your petitioner would most respectfully pray that your honor grant and order allowing him to, filr petition in said court and prosecute the same as a poor person without paying any fees therefor. C H Smith
Subscribed and swron to before me this 8th day of February 1889: Richard Osbourne Notary Public
